meanings.definition: The act of writing or drawing with a pencil.
meanings.sent1: Her pencilling was neat and precise on the paper.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy pencilling in my sketchbook during art class.
meanings.sent3: The detective's pencilling of clues helped solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His pencilling of emotions on the character's face was truly expressive.
meanings.sent5: The pencilling of the tree against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The process of outlining or planning something.
meanings.sent1: The pencilling of the project's timeline was essential for success.
meanings.sent2: We spent hours pencilling the details of our upcoming trip.
meanings.sent3: His pencilling of excuses was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: The pencilling of the strategy was like mapping out a battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The pencilling of the speech made it flow smoothly.

meanings.definition: The technique of shading or coloring with a pencil.
meanings.sent1: She mastered the art of pencilling shadows in her drawings.
meanings.sent2: The pencilling of the portrait added depth and dimension.
meanings.sent3: His pencilling of the sky made it look like a storm was coming.
meanings.sent4: The pencilling of the waves made the ocean come alive on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The pencilling of the flowers made them look so realistic.
